title: A Guide to Hiding a Message on Facebook Messenger

steps.title: Open a chat in Facebook Messenger.
steps.content: Open a chat in Facebook Messenger. Because the Spoiler option isn't available on your computer, you'll need to use the Messenger mobile app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. Spoiler is not available to everyone. If you aren't able to add a spoiler with this method, the Gift effect is a great workaround!

steps.title: Type your text.
steps.content: Type your text. Tap the text field at the bottom of the screen and use the on-screen keyboard to write your text.

steps.title: Select the text you want to add a spoiler to.
steps.content: Select the text you want to add a spoiler to. Formatting options will appear above the highlighted text.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . You'll see this three-dot icon to the right of the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Tap Spoiler.
steps.content: Tap Spoiler . If you don't see this option, the feature is not available in your area. If it's there, tap it to add a spoiler to the selected text.

steps.title: Send your message.
steps.content: Send your message. Once the other person receives your message, they can tap the spoilered text to reveal the hidden message.

steps.title: Open a conversation where you want to send a hidden text.
steps.content: Open a conversation where you want to send a hidden text. Since the Facebook website can't add effects to messages, you'll need to use the mobile app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. [1] X Research source The Gift effect is a great alternative to the Spoiler feature because it hides the text until the other person taps it.

steps.title: Type your text.
steps.content: Type your text. Tap the text field at the bottom of the screen and use the on-screen keyboard to write your text.

steps.title: Tap .
steps.content: Tap . This magnifying glass icon is located on the far right of the text field and will open a menu at the bottom.

steps.title: Tap the wrapped gift icon.
steps.content: Tap the wrapped gift icon. You'll see it under the "Send effects" header. You may need to scroll down or right to find it. Note that tapping this will immediately hide the entire message inside the gift-wrapped icon and the other person won't see the message until they tap it. If the person you're sending the message to is on a computer, they will see the message immediately followed by (sent with gift wrap effect) .
